message.content:
A psychoactive substance is a chemical substance that alters brain function, resulting in changes in perception, mood, consciousness, cognition, or behavior. Psychoactive substances are used for various purposes: medicinal (antidepressants and pain relievers), recreational (alcohol and marijuana), religious ceremonies and rituals (ayahuasca), and performance-enhancing purposes (caffeine).

Most commonly known psychoactive substances include:

1. Stimulants - These increase alertness, attention, energy levels, heart rate, blood pressure; e.g., caffeine from coffee/tea/chocolate; amphetamines like Adderall; cocaine.

2. Depressants - They slow down the activity of the central nervous system inhibiting arousallevelsand resultingin relaxation,ease anxiety,and reduce inhibition:e.g.alcohol(ethanol); benzodiazepines like Xanax(diazipam)or Valium(lorazepam).
